snippet: On Saturday, a standoff between police and protesters ended with stone throwing and tear gassing.
abstract: Death toll from street fighting between protesters and the police in Cairo rises to 12 as fierce clashes continue, set off by a deadly soccer riot; inability of the military-led government to diminish the violence raises new questions about its legitimacy during this paradoxical new stage in Egypt’s transition.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh and Liam Stack contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: On Saturday, a standoff between police and protesters ended with stone throwing and tear gassing.

headline.seo: In Egypt, More Deaths Reported as Clashes Continue
headline.main: Protests Over Soccer Match Riot Continue in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Clashes Continue in Aftermath of Egypt Soccer Riot, and More Are Said to Die

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
